result.execSummary:
The defendant Davontay D Ballinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder- While Attempting Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,448.29 payable to Donna Glassford.  To be joint and several with codefendants in cases 14CF1667 and 14CF1647.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
The Court imposed the applicable fees, assessments, restitution, Court costs and surcharges including a DNA assessment.  DOC to collect any monetary amounts at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in Secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervison.   Any amounts that remain unpaid when sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a  judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under Sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
--You may have to give a swab which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.

superMiscConds.notes: To be employed or enrolled in school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
Oral No Contact Order with the victims family and codefendants.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Felony Murder- While Attempting Armed Robbery
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davontay D Ballinger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per 06-03-16 e-mail from DA Lisa M., total restitution ordered = $2,448.29, broken down as follows:  $1054.90 to Donna G and $1,393.39 to Crime Victim Compensation.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing 03-08-2016 received and filed.  CH
received and filed from Debra Ballinger.
Oral No Contact Order with the Victims Family and Codefendants.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Jeffrey T. Wilson.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 690 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $2448.29 payable to Donna G. to be joint and several with codefendants in cases 14CF1667 and 14CF1647.
Defendant to undergo a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary. 
Defendant is to be employed or enrolled in school. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, restitution, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
The court has an all day motion hearing on 3.11.16 and will not be able to hear this case.

SEE CASE NO. 14CF1667 for Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 2/8/16 for Danielle B. for 4 appearances on 2/16/15, 9/28/15, 10/26/15, 2/2/16; Debra B. for 3 appearances on 2/16/15, 9/28/15, 10/26/15; Ray L. for 2 appearances on 2/16/15, 2/2/16.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Davontay D Ballinger not in court, in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant to testify in codefendant trial.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff T Wilson (USE 1064390) in court (via telephone), defendant Davontay D Ballinger not in court, in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Per Judge McAdams this case can be scheduled off the record.  Defense counsel was just appointed on this case.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has taken a new job and needs to withdraw.    Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Davontay D Ballinger not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Court is in trial. Per Judge McAdams this case can be adjourned off the record. Court was not aware this case was to be heard for a motion hearing today as it was calendared for a final pretrial. Motion to be heard on the day of trial.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Davontay D Ballinger not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing. Court previously found the defendant competent to stand trial on 7/09/15. Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Court will hear defense counsel's motion to suppress on the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant was previously remanded on 8/26/14 pending treatment to competency. Court ordered cash bail previously ordered in the amount $100,000.00 to be reinstated.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner on behalf of Antoni Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for competency hearing. The defense is still challenging the findings of Dr. Moran's and Dr. McGlynn's reports. Competency hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Dr. Adrea McGlynn who appeared via video conference. During Dr. McGlynn's testimony the video sound equipment malfunctioned and Dr. McGlynn continued testifying via telephone. Sworn for the State: Dr. Zachary Moran who appeared via telephone. Court took judicial notice of Dr. McGlynn's reports dated 5/13/15, 4/10/15 and of Dr. Moran's report dated 5/07/15. State rests. Defense counsel does not intend on calling any witnesses. Testimony closed. Court found to a reasonable degree of legal certainty the defendant is competent to proceed. Court ordered proceedings reinstated. Defendant is NOT to be returned to Mendota and shall remain in the Milwaukee County Jail. Defense counsel previously filed a motion to suppress the defendant's statements. Court ordered this matter adjourned to allow for ADA Apollo to appear to set future court dates. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, THURSDAY JULY 09, 2015 AT 3:00 P.M. IN BR 25, SB RM 620. kl
Transcript commencing 04/29/20147 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14cf1647 (31 Pages).

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for competency hearing. This matter was set for 1:30 p.m. and passed until 3:00 p.m. for defense counsel to conclude his trial in Branch 7. Parties in court at 4:00 p.m. prepared to proceed, however Mendota was no longer able to accommodate the hearing due to scheduling conflicts. Court ordered the matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctor's report dated 05/14/2015. Parties have received and reviewed the report. Defense is challenging the findings. Parties request Dr. McGlynn and Dr. Moran be allowed to testify via video conference. Court granted joint request. Case remains in suspended status. Defendant will remain in the Criminal Justice Facility until the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original report by Dr. McGlynn received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Faxed copy of Dr. McGlynn's report dated 5/13/15 received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

This matter needs to be rescheduled to comply with the statutory time periods. Parties notified. Case rescheduled to 5/27/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Return on Doctor's Report in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter to the Court from Dr. Moran at the Deparment of Health Services received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter from Dr. Adrea McGlynn at the Department of Health Services requesting a copy of Dr. Tyre's report dated 7/24/2015.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. Parties are not challenging the findings in the report. Court accepts findings of Dr. Moran and finds the defendant not competent but likely to regain compentency within the statutory timeframe. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Davontay D Ballinger not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for this hearing. Parties are not challenging the findings in the report. Court accepts findings of Dr. Moran and Dr. Lee and finds the defendant not competent but likely to regain compentency within the statutory timeframe. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Novack in court requesting a new date to review the doctor's report. Court grants request. State notified. Case rescheduled to 12/01/14 at 8:30 a.m. for Return on Doctor's Report in Branch 25. New court date is within the statutory time limits. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Doctor's Report received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Mark S. Williams on behalf of Antoni Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp. 
Case set for return on doctor's report. Parties reviewed the report by Dr. Collins. State and defense are not challenging the doctor's findings. Court accepts opinions of Dr. Collins and finds the defendant not competent but likely to regain competency. Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency. Court ordered proceedings SUSPENDED. Order signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility.  The defendant shall be given 127 days of credit for precommitment incarceration.  The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody. Court vacated jury trial date of 10/27/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Based on Dr. Tyre's findings in his report, parties make joint request for a competency evaluation in this matter. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Bail remains the same at this time. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/27/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion Requesting Competency Evaluation with attachment received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

ADA Apollo in court, attorney Novack appeared via telephone. Based on defense counsel's motion to suppress filed this morning, ADA Apollo requests this matter be put on the calendar to address request for a competency evaluation. Case adjourned to 7/24/14 at 3:00 p.m. for motion hearing in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statement with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel did not file a motion to suppress. Defense is waiting for a report from Dr. Tyre to determine if a motion to suppress is appropriate. Counsel expects to received the report next week and requests a short adjournment. Court vacated jury trial date of 8/04/14 at the defense request. State placed offer on the record. State amended witness list on the record. If deemed appropriate, defense counsel to file motion by 8/01/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Jury trial scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Letter from attorney Novack requesting an extension of time to filed motion. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter from the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Amended Witness List, received and filed.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Original Information previously filed on 04/29/2014. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel will be filing a motion to suppress defendant's statements. Parties to be prepared to argue any motions on the final pretrial date as well as file witness lists, motions in limine, and jury instructions. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Erik Gulbrandson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders Defendant to be kept separate from Co-Defendants Terry Blunt and Corren Mattox

Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Davontay D Ballinger in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
